column4: is there an ubuntu friendly channel for networking questions?

there's ##networking, if you don't mind a "generic" answer that will most likely get you punching in keys on a terminal
that's why i was looking. that channel isn't overly active or helpful
that is denyhosts.conf is for ftp progs?
it's for ssh
afaik opensshd doesn't listen to the old deny/allow hosts files... you can set it to not allow root logins in the sshd.conf or whatever file it is
or do I misunderstand teh purpose of the directive you're trying to set?
so denyhosts won't work with ssh? i that's that's what it's for
oh, I was thinking of a different program, sorry
well, denyhosts seems to do the job, it just doesn't ban at 1 for root like it's configured
it bans properly for other violations though?
seems to. most attempts are for root but for other non-existent accounts they get banned after 3 (i think)
i can paste a log if that helps
nah, I don't know anything about the program, was just wondering if maybe it was having trouble executing the "blocking" routine(iptables, route, whatever)
i meant the auth.log but it does block IPs. they do get added after 10 attempts. i have it set to 1 though and not sure why it isn't working
I'd scrap that all together, just change your port to a non-standard one, disable root login and password logins(key only), and use portsentry to ban any IP that hits the default ssh port
i've been reluctant to use a non-standard port 'cause i'm afraid I might not be able to connect from work if the port i choose is blocked
i don't have a root login enabled but just want to limit the attempts
ah, I see... corporate outgoing firewals suck :( put it on email port if you're not using email already ;)
